name: BLANC
slogan: Natural Artisan Dry Cleaners: quality, convenient dry cleaning without the toxic products
description:
Not many people know, but conventional dry cleaning is extremely toxic. Despite its name, conventional dry cleaning is neither dry nor clean, as this process includes soaking the garments in solvent-based cleaners.
At BLANC, we want to change that. We believe that the world needs a sustainable and convenient way of cleaning the many clothes designers produce each year and that people want a trusted and caring partner to do this for them. A partner who understands that we need to make clothes last. BLANC is a natural artisan dry cleaner, tailor and launderer with award-winning stores in central London and a large Atelier in West London.
Since launching in 2013 we have cleaned close to a million garments and served over 18,000 customers across London. As the UK’s fastest-growing natural garment care specialist, we are working with some of the most exciting fashion brands in the world. We are an innovative company with an entrepreneurial spirit and a great passion for everything we do.

team.title: CEO and Founder

team.bioHtml: CEO and Founder at BLANC, a premium eco-friendly clothes cleaner all about nature, quality and convenience. Strong business background (JPMorgan, HEC Paris).

jobs.title: Store Assistant
jobs.description:
BLANC is expanding at a very fast pace and we are now looking for energetic and motivated individuals to help our Store Managers serve customers in our current and soon to be opened stores across London. 

Please note that this is a full-time job.

About BLANC
Not many people know, but conventional dry cleaning is extremely toxic. Despite its name, conventional dry cleaning is neither dry nor clean, as this process includes soaking the garments in solvent-based cleaners. 

At BLANC, we believe that the world needs a sustainable and convenient way of cleaning the many clothes designers produce each year, and that people want a trusted and caring partner to do this for them. A partner who understands that we need to make clothes last. 

BLANC is a natural artisan dry cleaner, tailor and launderer with award-winning stores in Marylebone, Notting Hill, Chelsea, White City, South Kensington and a large Atelier in West London (where all the fun stuff happens). Since launching in 2013, BLANC has cleaned all clothes, even the most delicate, in a healthy, natural and sustainable way. We use biodegradable and health-friendly detergents instead of the toxic chemical solvents traditionally used by conventional dry cleaners. We treat our staff fairly and honestly and care a lot about their working conditions. 

Since launching in 2013 we have cleaned close to a million garments and served over 18,000 customers across London. As the UK’s fastest-growing natural garment care specialist, we are working with some of the most exciting fashion brands in the world. We are an innovative company with an entrepreneurial spirit and a great passion for everything we do. Read more about our adventures in Vogue, The Telegraph or The Guardian.


Your responsibilities as a Store Assistant
- Ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent customer service
- Maintaining outstanding store condition and maintain a fully stocked store
- Working on till, processing transactions
- Inspecting garments coming in store
- Organising production, sorting and packaging garments on a day-to-day basis

What we are looking for
- A suitable level of spoken English required
- Experience in retail/customer-facing role a big plus
- Strong attention to detail needed, and commitment to delivering high-quality service at all times

Personality traits: caring, dynamic and enthusiastic; solution-oriented, very organised; green-minded, a natural interest in health and environmental issues

What's in it for you?
- Become one of the early-stage employees in the industry’s fastest-growing natural garment care company
- Be part of a company which places environmental and social values at the heart of everything we do
- Open, respectful and fun company culture with Summer and Christmas parties
- Learn about designers, fabrics and garment care technology - no job in fashion sees such an extensive variety of designs!
- Recreation / Staff Area with free organic fruit, coffee, tea, milk (and usually lots of birthday cakes!)
- Attractive compensation
- Strong focus on your professional development and many opportunities for career evolution

This is a chance to help shape the future of an entire industry. Send in your application - and we'll get going together! To apply, click below to send your CV with a brief introductory email outlining why you would be a great addition to our team. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Your responsibilities as a Store Manager

- Sale of wardrobe care products and advising on all of BLANC’s services
- Building new and maintaining existing relationships with customers 
- Managing Store Assistants and Stock Assistants

- Reporting of financial data and updates to line manager
-General housekeeping
 
What we are looking for
- An appropriate level of English (spoken and written)
- At least 2 years experience in a high-end retail / customer-facing role

- Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering top quality
- Caring and dynamic, solution-oriented and well organised
- A ‘hands on’ mentality and a ‘can do’ attitude

jobs.title: Training Manager
jobs.description:
BLANC is looking for an enthusiastic and hardworking Training Manager to join the People Team in our North Acton head office.

Your responsibilities as a Training Manager

Onboarding
- Develop and deliver the initial 2-week onboarding process and ensuring new team members reach the highest standards of working capability.
- Managing the new starter tracker - ensuring necessary documentation is received, checked and shared with other departments, as appropriate
- Ensuring IT equipment is ordered and set up on time 
- Guide new joiners through the first weeks of employment, ensuring they are kept informed of their programs
- Preparing the right printed training materials for the new joiners and organise quiz to test knowledge
- Assigning “buddies”  (in-company mentors) 

Training
- Own, build and deliver training with high impact to existing and new employees
- Conduct improvement training where a lack of competence has been identified
- Provide ‘mini’ refresher learning sessions to the recruitment team
- Identify relevant training courses that will meet the existing and future needs BLANC team members
- Training of external partners: fashion stores or other partners.
- Work with the People Team and Managers to review training needs analysis across the business
- Ensure that all training material is organised, filed and documented correctly
- Make sure training materials are updated in line with current trends, best practice and new regulations

Recruitment:
- Direct source candidates using a range of methods and tools, building a shortlist of candidates to present to the People manager.
- Effectively telephone interview candidates and clearly articulate recommendations to the People Team.
- Accountable for the candidate experience ensuring queries are responded promptly and you’ll need to work closely with our communications and marketing teams to align external messaging
- Assisting and supporting managers to recruit staff internally

About you
- You have the right to work in the UK and are available to attend interviews. 
- 2-3 years experience in a similar role
- Experience in recruiting, ideally across a variety of functions
- Proven experience of delivering training and generating training materials 
- Enthusiastic, proactive and optimistic
- Great people skills and training capabilities
- Good presentation, planning and organisational skills
- Ability to multi-task and prioritise work
- Innovative mindset, ability to think “on your feet” in a constantly moving and strongly growing environment
- Proficiency in MS Office
- Green-minded absolutely key

What's in it for you?
- Become one of the early-stage employees in the industry’s fastest-growing natural garment care company
- Be part of a company which places environmental and social values at the heart of everything we do
- Open, respectful and fun company culture with Summer and Christmas parties
- Learn about designers, fabrics and garment care technology - no job in fashion sees such an extensive variety of designs!
- Recreation / Staff Area with free organic fruit, coffee, tea, milk (and usually lots of birthday cakes!)
- Attractive compensation
- Strong focus on your professional development and many opportunities for career evolution.

To apply, send your CV with a brief introductory email to talents@blancliving.co outlining why you would be a great addition to our team. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
